channel.title: CVE Feed for jotform -- Jotform Online Forms – Drag & Drop Form Builder, Securely Embed Contact Forms
channel.description: The latest CVEs for jotform -- Jotform Online Forms – Drag & Drop Form Builder, Securely Embed Contact Forms

item.title: CVE-2024-2542|2024-08-01T19:18:47.005Z -- jotform -- jotform%20online%20forms%20%E2%80%93%20drag%20%26%20drop%20form%20builder%2C%20securely%20embed%20contact%20forms
item.description: The Jotform Online Forms – Drag & Drop Form Builder, Securely Embed Contact Forms plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's shortcode(s) in all versions up to, and including, 1.3.1 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page. CVE-2024-32527 is likely a duplicate of this issue.

This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
